title: Our Team
text:
Dr. Murat Karakus
Murat Karakus received a B.S. degree in Mathematics from Suleyman Demirel University, Türkiye, in 2009, and the M.S. degree in Computer Science and Information Systems from the University of Michigan-Flint, USA, in 2013, and the Ph.D. degree in the Computer Science from Purdue School of Science in Indianapolis, USA, in 2018. He is currently working as an Associate Professor at the Department of Software Engineering at Ankara University in Türkiye. He is the recipient of the Best Paper Award at ACM SIGITE 2011 conference. He has 50+ peer-reviewed publications and serves as a reviewer for esteemed IEEE, ACM, and Elsevier journals and conferences. His current research interests include next-generation network architectures, such as Software-Defined Networking (SDN), Blockchain technology, NLP, network scalability, QoS, and routing. He has led various research and industry projects.









   



Dr. Rukiye Savran Kiziltepe
Rukiye Savran Kızıltepe received her BSc degree from Hacettepe University, Ankara, in 2014, and her MSc and PhD degrees from the School of Computer Science and Electronic Engineering at the University of Essex, Colchester, in 2017 and 2022, respectively. She is currently an Assistant Professor in the Department of Software Engineering at Karadeniz Technical University. Her research interests includes Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Computer Vision, and Natural Language Processing. She actively engages in international and interdisciplinary AI projects, keen on applying theoretical knowledge to real-world challenges across diverse fields.









   



Dr. Ercan Ezin
Ercan Ezin recently completed his Ph.D. in Context-Aware Recommender Systems from the University of Bristol in May 2024. He holds an M.S. in Advanced Computer Science from the University of Essex, UK, and dual B.S. degrees in Computer Education and Instructional Technologies and Software Engineering from Bahçeşehir University, Türkiye. Dr. Ezin’s research focuses on AI and machine learning, particularly in Context-Aware Next-POI Recommendations and, more recently, Natural Language Processing. With extensive experience as an AI Researcher and Teaching Assistant at the University of Bristol, he has published papers in top-tier conferences on recommender systems and is actively involved in NLP projects. Dr. Ezin’s industry background includes roles as a Java Software Developer, Data Scientist, and IT Director, bringing a blend of academic expertise and practical software development skills to his work. Dr. Ezin has been appointed as a tenured faculty member at Harran University, Türkiye.

title: Advanced Natural Language and Multimedia Processing Lab
text:
The Advanced Natural LAnguage and Multimedia Processing Lab is part of the Software Engineering Department at Ankara University , dedicated to advancing research in Natural Language Processing (NLP) and multimedia technologies. The lab was established in 2024 and focuses on cutting-edge AI research, particularly in NLP, multimedia processing, and their intersection. Our work spans various domains, with current projects including (in no particular order):
For those interested in collaborating or joining our lab, please get in touch via Contact Page.

title: Advanced Natural Language and Multimedia Processing Lab
text:
Latest News

12 Sep ’24-We are pleased to announce that our research project has been awarded a funding by the Deanship of Scientific Research (DSR) at King Abdulaziz University under grant no. GPIP: 1789-612-2024.


Doç. Dr. Murat Karakus from Software Engineering, Ankara University


Dr. Rukiye Savran Kızıltepe from Software Engineering, Karadeniz Technical University


Dr. Ercan Ezin from Computer Engineering, Harran University


Dr. Arwa Mohmmed Basbrain from Computer Science, King Abdulaziz University




6 Sep ’24 – Exciting news! ANLAM LAB has been awarded Google Cloud research credits to support our cutting-edge NLP studies. This generous grant will empower our team to leverage state-of-the-art cloud computing resources for our multimedia processing and sentiment analysis projects. We’re thrilled about the possibilities this opens up for our research, including faster data processing, more complex model training, and the potential to tackle even more ambitious challenges in natural language understanding. Stay tuned for updates on how we’re putting these credits to work in advancing the field of NLP!


28 Aug ’24 – ANLAM LAB is BORN! Our team is excited to collaborate with industry leaders on a new project involving multimedia processing and sentiment analysis. Stay tuned for updates!


14 Aug ’24 – It is with the greatest joy that we announce our second conference paper on Turkish NLP studies has been accepted for the UBMK 2024 Conference, which will be held in Antalya, Türkiye, between October 26-28, 2024!


22 Jul ’24 – We successfully submitted a new paper to ASYU’24 conference! Update: The paper has been accepted. More info on Publications Page. See you at ASYU Conference in Gazi University, Ankara, Türkiye.

title: "Decoding Meaning in the Digital Age"
text:
Our Vision
At ANLAM LAB, we believe that language is the key to unlocking human knowledge and experience. Our name which literally translates to “meaning” in Turkish, reflects our core mission: to discover the intricacies of communication, both textual and multimedia.

title: "Decoding Meaning in the Digital Age"
text:
Beyond Processing: Understanding
While many labs process data, at ANLAM, we strive to understand it. Established in 2024 at Ankara University, Türkiye, we’re not just observers of the AI revolution in language and multimedia – we’re active participants, shaping the future of how machines comprehend and generate human-like communication starting from low-resource languages to a variety of applications.

title: "Decoding Meaning in the Digital Age"
text:
Our Unique Approach
What sets ANLAM apart is our holistic view of language and multimedia:

Interdisciplinary Synergy: We blend expertise from linguistics, computer science, cognitive psychology, and data science to tackle complex language problems.
Cultural Context: With a focus on Turkish and multi-lingual NLP, we’re exploring how cultural nuances impact language understanding and generation.
Ethical AI: We’re committed to developing NLP systems that are not only powerful but also fair, transparent, and respectful of privacy.
Real-World Impact: Our research isn’t confined to the lab. We actively seek partnerships to apply our findings to solve real-world challenges.

title: "Decoding Meaning in the Digital Age"
text:
Research Philosophy
At ANLAM, we believe in:

Curiosity-Driven Exploration: We encourage our team to pursue novel ideas, even if they seem unconventional at first.
Collaborative Innovation: We thrive on partnerships, both within academia and with industry leaders.
Open Science: Whenever possible, we share our findings and tools with the global research community.
Continuous Learning: In the fast-paced world of AI, we’re committed to staying at the cutting edge through continuous learning and adaptation.


Our Commitment

Advancing the field of NLP and multimedia processing
Fostering a diverse and inclusive research environment
Bridging the gap between academic research and real-world applications
Nurturing the next generation of AI researchers and practitioners :::

title: "Decoding Meaning in the Digital Age"
text:
Join Our Journey
Whether you’re a seasoned researcher, an industry partner looking to innovate, or a student passionate about NLP and multimedia, there’s a place for you at ANLAM.

For Researchers: Join us in pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in language and multimedia processing.
For Industry: Partner with us to bring cutting-edge NLP solutions to real-world challenges.
For Students: Immerse yourself in an environment that fosters growth, creativity, and excellence in AI research.

title: "Decoding Meaning in the Digital Age"
section: Let’s Shape the Future of Communication
text:
Let’s Shape the Future of Communication
At ANLAM, we’re not just studying language and multimedia – we’re reimagining how humans and machines will communicate in the future. Are you ready to be part of this exciting journey?
